1:
My God, my God, why have you abandoned me?
\q Why are you so far from saving me and far from the words of my anguish?
\q
2:
My God, I cry out in the daytime, but you do not answer,
\q and at night I am not silent!
5:
They cried to you and they were rescued.
\q They trusted in you and were not disappointed.
6:
But I am a worm and not a man,
\q a disgrace to humanity and despised by the people.
\q
10:
I have been thrown on you from the womb;
\q you are my God since I was in my mother's womb!
13:
They open their mouths wide against me
\q like a roaring lion ripping its victim.
14:
I am being poured out like water,
\q and all my bones are dislocated.
\q My heart is like wax;
\q it melts away within my inner parts.
\q
17:
I can count all my bones.
\q They look and stare at me.
18:
They divide my garments among themselves,
\q they cast lots for my clothes.
\q
19:
Do not be far away, Yahweh;
\q please hurry to help me, my strength!
20:
Rescue my soul from the sword,
\q my only life from the claws of wild dogs.
\q
21:
Save me from the lion's mouth;
\q rescue me from the horns of the wild oxen.
23:
You who fear Yahweh, praise him!
\q All you descendants of Jacob, honor him!
\q Stand in awe of him, all you descendants of Israel!
25:
My praise will be because of you in the great assembly;
\q I will fulfill my vows before those who fear him.
26:
The oppressed will eat and be satisfied;
\q those who seek Yahweh will praise him.
\q May your hearts live forever.
\q
27:
All the peoples of the earth will remember and turn to Yahweh;
\q all the families of the nations will bow down before you.
31:
They will come and tell of his righteousness;
\q they will tell to a people not yet born what he has done!
